intro: Sabicea surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam sabicea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the legume or bean family. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Sabicea surinamensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
